actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-801, by Mr. Beilenson.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4825 with 1 hour 0 of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order. No amendment to the bill shall be in order except the amendments printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution. Said amendments shall be considered and debated in the manner specified in the report. Mr. Crane and Mr. Rohrabacher shall each be allowed to offer amendments en bloc.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 177.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 4825) to amend the National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act of 1965, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 4825 (arts and humanities funding).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 4825) to amend the National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act of 1965, and for other purposes.
